name: EKS and LB IPs.txt - cde-blue-eks - private EKS
description: This section appears to be about a private Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) cluster named 'cde-blue-eks'. EKS is a managed Kubernetes service provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS) that allows users to run and manage containerized applications on a cluster of Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instances. A private EKS cluster means that the Kubernetes control plane and worker nodes are not publicly accessible from the internet, providing an additional layer of security for sensitive workloads.
use_cases: Deploying and managing containerized applications in a secure and isolated environment
Running sensitive or regulated workloads that require enhanced security measures
Hosting internal applications or services that should not be exposed to the public internet

name: EKS and LB IPs.txt - cde-green-eks - private EKS

EKS is a managed Kubernetes service provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS) for running containerized applications. use_cases: Deploying and managing containerized applications in a secure and isolated environment
Running mission-critical workloads that require enhanced security and privacy
Hosting applications that handle sensitive data or have strict compliance requirements

name: EKS and LB IPs.txt - EKS OIDC endpoints:
description: This section provides information about the OpenID Connect (OIDC) endpoints used by Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) clusters. These endpoints are Network Load Balancer (NLB) URLs and IP addresses that facilitate secure communication and authentication between the EKS control plane and worker nodes. The section mentions that these OIDC endpoints will eventually be replaced by EKS public endpoints once the OIDC namespace is removed from the EKS clusters.
use_cases: Secure communication between EKS control plane and worker nodes
Authentication and authorization for EKS components
Facilitating secure access to EKS resources
Enabling secure communication within the EKS ecosystem
